column4: mount -l will give you a list which should include any CDs mounted when you run it.
-.- why do I always think of the hard way to do it? :P I was about to suggest 'cat /etc/fstab | grep /mnt/cdrom'
I don't think that would show it. My fstab has no entry for my cdrom, they just get automounted when I put one in.
Oh... didn't think of that, can't exactly test right now, on an eeepc with no optical drive atm.
